parts.text: [{"extra_ingredients": "Olive oil, salt, pepper", "recipe_instructions": "1. Wash and chop potatoes and sweet potatoes into bite-sized pieces. 2. Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until tender.", "recipe_name": "Roasted Sweet Potatoes and Potatoes"}, {"extra_ingredients": "Butter, salt, pepper", "recipe_instructions": "1. Cook ditalini pasta according to package directions. 2. While pasta cooks, heat butter in a pan. 3. Add cooked pasta, salt, and pepper; stir to combine. 4. Serve immediately.", "recipe_name": "Simple Ditalini"}, {"extra_ingredients": "Olive oil, salt, pepper", "recipe_instructions": "1. Heat olive oil in a pan. 2. Sauté zucchini and mushrooms until tender. 3. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 4. Serve as a side dish.", "recipe_name": "Sautéed Zucchini and Mushrooms"}, {"extra_ingredients": "Olive oil, salt, pepper, onion (optional)", "recipe_instructions": "1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 2. If using, sauté chopped onion until softened. 3. Add chopped cilantro and parsley. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until slightly wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste.", "recipe_name": "Cilantro-Parsley Saute"}, {"extra_ingredients": "None", "recipe_instructions": "1. If you have multiple types of tortillas, choose one or combine flavors. 2. You can make tacos, quesadillas, or wraps depending on your preference. 3. Add any of the cooked vegetables from other recipes as fillings. For example, you can use the roasted sweet potatoes and potatoes or the sautéed zucchini and mushrooms. 4. Use the yogurt as a sauce or side.", "recipe_name": "Tortilla Wraps with Vegetables and Yogurt"}]
